channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Plymouth shooting: Suspected gunman and five others die
item.description: A Plymouth MP says one of the victims was a child and more people are being treated in hospital.

item.title: Cheshire care worker caught on camera sexually assaulting patient
item.description: Benjamin Poole, 21, is jailed for six years after admitting seven offences.

item.title: M4 near Langley and Slough to close for further smart motorway work
item.description: The weekend closure between junctions five and six will last until Monday, Highways England says.

item.title: Priti Patel: Men jailed over racist Snapchat video that went viral
item.description: The racist Snapchat video went viral and was viewed by millions of people.

item.title: Kip Freshwater: 'Smelly pants wee' boy's cancer fight legacy
item.description: The parents of Kip Freshwater say they are uplifted by those remembering their son's shouted words.

item.title: Ryanair sorry it made autistic Harlow boy take Covid test
item.description: The boy's mother says he was "petrified" about being forced to have the test, despite being exempt.

item.title: Somerset mum creates dream prom for child with rare disease
item.description: Kiera's mother wanted her to be able to enjoy a school prom before she embarks on further treatment.

item.title: Covid: Knowsley Council ponders sick day rule for unvaccinated staff
item.description: Knowsley Council is considering reclassifying self-isolation for the unvaccinated as sick leave.

item.title: Builder fleeced vulnerable victims out of £100,000
item.description: George Allen is described by a judge as a "dyed in the wool fraudster"

item.title: Charity aims to school taxi drivers to look for signs of distress
item.description: Not the Last Stop aims to help taxi drivers recognise when customers might be considering self harm.

item.title: Victoria station bus crash victim named as Melissa Burr
item.description: Melissa Burr was killed when two single-decker buses crashed outside London Victoria rail station.

item.title: 'Penny-sized' mouse rescued after cat scares mother away
item.description: The tiny newborn was about the size of a one pence coin when she was found at a house in Newcastle.

item.title: Olympic Gadirova twins 'thrilled' at school grades
item.description: The 16-year-old Olympic medallists plan to stay on to study sport and management while competing.

item.title: GCSE results 2021: Student with cerebral palsy celebrates with mum
item.description: Jonny, 16, waited to open his GCSE results so he could share the moment with his mum.

item.title: GCSE results 2021: Exams triumph for boy who spent year in hospital
item.description: Jason Ledford hopes to become a nurse after undergoing treatment for a brain tumour.

item.title: GCSE results 2021: How were grades decided?
item.description: Teachers have decided their pupils' grades after Covid cancelled exams for a second year.

item.title: GCSE results 2021: Will employers judge Covid grades badly? And other questions
item.description: Our experts answer your questions about GCSE results, after a second year without formal exams.

item.title: Bomb threat arrest at Northampton police station caught on film
item.description: A man is seen being tackled to the ground by officers after claiming he had a bomb in a bag.

item.title: Kane, Southgate and Sterling mural in Nuneaton nets £10,000
item.description: The three lions on the wall painting in Nuneaton helps to fund seven defibrillators.

item.title: Covid-19 testing 'mega lab' officially opens in Leamington Spa
item.description: The Leamington Spa facility has already processed about 300,000 coronavirus tests.

item.title: Success for women's skateboarding group after Olympic triumph
item.description: Team GB's Olympic skateboarders inspire new interest in Leeds all-female skateboarding group.

item.title: Blind couple refused entry by Leicester Square restaurants
item.description: Siobhan Meade and her husband were turned away from two Leicester Square restaurants.

item.title: England v India: KL Rahul century helps tourists take control at Lord's
item.description: England suffer a demoralising first day of the second Test as an unbeaten KL Rahul century leads India towards a huge total at Lord's.

item.title: Super League: St Helens 10-20 Castleford Tigers - Cas win to end 31-year wait
item.description: Castleford Tigers stun 12-man champions St Helens and secure a first league win at Saints since October 1990.

item.title: John Simpson stars as Superchargers pile up The Hundred's first 200
item.description: Northern Superchargers rack up 200 in an incredible 69-run win over Manchester Originals as the visitors wilt at a raucous Headingley.

item.title: Romelu Lukaku: Chelsea re-sign Belgium striker from Inter Milan for a club record £97.5m
item.description: Chelsea have re-signed Belgium striker Romelu Lukaku from Inter Milan for £97.5m.

item.title: Glamorgan & Durham make One-Day Cup semis as Gloucs, Surrey, Yorkshire & Essex also progress
item.description: Durham and Glamorgan earn home One-Day Cup semi-finals, with Gloucestershire, Surrey and Yorkshire joining Essex in quarter-finals.
